references.paper_title: Mastering the game of Go with deep neural networks and tree search
references.reason: This paper introduced AlphaGo, a groundbreaking AI system that mastered the game of Go, demonstrating the power of combining deep learning with tree search algorithms, which is fundamental to many reasoning language models.

references.paper_title: Mastering the game of Go without human knowledge
references.reason: This paper presented AlphaZero, a more general reinforcement learning algorithm that surpassed AlphaGo by mastering Go, chess, and shogi from scratch without any prior domain knowledge, showcasing the power of self-play reinforcement learning in developing strong AI agents.

references.paper_title: Training Verifiers to Solve Math Word Problems
references.reason: This paper introduced a novel approach to training language models for mathematical reasoning by using a verifier model to assess the correctness of generated solutions, significantly improving the accuracy and reliability of the models.

references.paper_title: Chain-of-Thought Prompting Elicits Reasoning in Large Language Models
references.reason: This paper demonstrated that prompting large language models with chain-of-thought instructions significantly enhances their reasoning capabilities, introducing a simple yet highly effective technique widely adopted in various reasoning models.

references.paper_title: Graph of Thoughts: Solving Elaborate Problems with Large Language Models
references.reason: This paper introduced a novel reasoning scheme called "Graph of Thoughts," which extends the chain-of-thought paradigm by representing reasoning steps as a graph, enabling more complex and flexible reasoning processes compared to linear chains.
